```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
f <- sample(10:99, 1) # force (N)
m <- sample(1:9, 1) # mass (kg)
a <- f / m # mass (kg)

sc <- num_to_schoice(a, delta = a/10, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sprintf("\\SI{%.1f}{m/s^2}", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```

Question
========
A net force of `r fmt(f,1)` N acts on an object of mass `r fmt(m,2)` kg. 
What is the acceleration of the object?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```


Solution
========
According to Newton's Second Law of Motion
$$
a = F / m = (\SI{`r f`}{N}) / (\SI{`r m`}{kg}) = \SI{`r signif(a, 2)`}{m/s^2}
$$
